text: Hypatima acicula is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Kyu- Tek Park and Margarita Gennadievna Ponomarenko in 1999. It is found in Thailand. The length of the forewings is about 13 mm. The forewings are light orange with a dark brown median costal patch, accompanied by a greyish-orange stripe. There are three to four small, dark brown patches before the apex separated by whitish short streaks. The hindwings are grey. ==Etymologly== The species name refers to the needle-like seta on the apices of the juxta lobes in the male genitalia and is derived from Latin acus.Species Diversity 4: 326 ==References== Category:Hypatima Category:Moths described in 1999
title: Hypatima acicula
